intro: Carex hakkodensis, commonly known as the Hakkodé sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its foliage is grass-like, with narrow, linear leaves that are usually dark green in color. Carex hakkodensis produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family.
